greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of n-node rooted identity trees with thinning limbs and root outdegree (branching factor) k; triangle T(n,k), n>=1, 0<=k<=max-index-of-row(n), read by rows.
comment: In a rooted tree with thinning limbs the outdegree of a parent node is larger than or equal to the outdegree of any of its child nodes.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..140, flattened
example: The A124346(7) = 6 7-node rooted identity trees with thinning limbs sorted by root outdegree are:
:  o  :   o     o       o      o   :   o   :
:  o  : o   o o   o   o   o  o   o : o o o :
:  o  : o     o   o o   o   o o  o : o o   :
:  o  : o     o     o       o      : o     :
maple: b:= proc(n, i, h, v) option remember; `if`(n=0, `if`(v=0, 1, 0),
`if`(i<1 or v<1 or n<v, 0, add(binomial(A(i, min(i-1, h)), j)
g:= proc(n) local k; if n=1 then 0 else
for k while T(n, k)>0 do od; k-1 fi
mathematica: b[n_, i_, h_, v_] := b[n, i, h, v] = If[n==0, If[v==0, 1, 0], If[i<1 || v<1 || n<v, 0, Sum[Binomial[A[i, Min[i-1, h]], j]*b[n-i*j, i-1, h, v-j], {j, 0, Min[n/i, v]}]]]; A[n_, k_] := A[n, k] = If[n<2, n, Sum[b[n-1, n-1, j, j], {j, 1, Min[k, n-1]}]]; g[n_] := If[n==1, 0, For[k=1, T[n, k]>0, k++]; k-1]; T[n_, k_] := b[n-1, n-1, k, k]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 25}, {k, 0, g[n]}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 18 2017, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 12 2014
